SUICIDE.Definition: the act of intentionally killing oneself

TREASON.Definition: the crime of betraying one's country by acting against it

ANTI-SEMITISM.Definition: hate, discrimination, or hostility against Jewish people

MISCARRIAGE.Definition: failure or error in judgement or outcome

PIONEER.Definition: someone who was among the first to explore or settle in a new area

TORMENTED.Definition: subjected to physical or mental suffering

TORRENTIAL.Definition: involving heavy or intense rainfall or flow

SCANDAL.Definition: event or action that caused public shock and anger

FLEE.Definition: run away or escape from a dangerous or difficult situation

TENSIONS.Definition: feelings of hostility or strained relations

REFORMS.Definition: changes made to improve or update something

ENTRENCHED.Definition: firmly established and difficult to change or remove

BINS.Definition: containers for storing waste or garbage

ATTACHÃ‰.Definition: diplomatic official assigned to an embassy or consulate

CAUGHT RED HANDED.Definition: found in the middle of committing a crime

DIG UP.Definition: uncover or find by searching or investigating

SOURCE.Definition: person from whom he was getting information

INCRIMINATING.Definition: providing evidence of his involvement in a crime or wrongdoing

RUBBISH BIN.Definition: container for throwing away waste or unwanted items

HANDLERS.Definition: people who managed or organised her activities

TRAITOR.Definition: person who was not loyal to his country

MOTIVE.Definition: reason or incentive for doing it

SUPERIORS.Definition: people in a higher position or rank

CONFESSION.Definition: statement or admission acknowledging guilt or involvement in it

BULLET.Definition: small metal object fired from a gun

CONSPIRACY.Definition: secret plan to do something harmful or illegal

PRIME SUSPECT.Definition: the person considered most likely to have committed the crime

CUSTODY.Definition: the state of being kept in a prison

ALLEGED.Definition: claimed or asserted to be true but without proof or confirmation

TREACHERY.Definition: betrayal of trust, an act of disloyalty

ARCHENEMY.Definition: ultimate or biggest enemy or opponent

COLLUDING.Definition: cooperating or conspiring in a secret way

ALLEGATIONS.Definition: claims or accusations made without proof

CAUGHT IN THE ACT.Definition: caught while doing something wrong or illegal

DISCERNIBLE.Definition: able to be perceived or recognised

VERDICT.Definition: decision or judgement in a trial

HIGH TREASON.Definition: a very serious crime which involved putting his country in danger

ABOLISHED.Definition: officially ended or put an end to

PENAL COLONY.Definition: place where prisoners were sent to serve their sentences

JEERING.Definition: laughing or shouting insults at him

YELLING.Definition: shouting or raising their voice loudly

SOLITARY CONFINEMENT.Definition: being kept in a small, isolated cell or space

PACKED OFF.Definition: sent away or dismissed without warning

EXCEPTION.Definition: something that wouldn't follow the usual rule

CONSPIRED.Definition: plotted or planned together secretly or illegally

OOPS.Definition: used to express surprise or acknowledge a mistake

SLIP OFF INTO THE NIGHT.Definition: quietly leave or escape unnoticed or secretly

RATIONALLY.Definition: in a reasonable or logical way

INTENSIFIED.Definition: increased or became stronger or more severe

HEADLINE.Definition: heading or title at the top of an article or page

FABRICATIONS.Definition: false or invented information or stories

DEFAMATION.Definition: the act of damaging the good reputation

CALLED INTO QUESTION.Definition: doubted or challenged as being true or accurate

FINE.Definition: sum of money paid as a penalty

CONFESSED.Definition: admitted or acknowledged that he was guilty

RETRIAL.Definition: new trial that would take place after the original one

FACE TRIAL.Definition: be judged for the crime in a court of law

EXTENUATING CIRCUMSTANCES.Definition: facts or circumstances that made his situation less serious or deserving less blame

FACTORS.Definition: facts or circumstances that contributed to the result or outcome

REINSTATED.Definition: restored or put back to his previous position

INJUSTICES.Definition: unfair or unjust acts or treatment

EXONERATION.Definition: the act of officially declaring him not guilty or free from blame
